title: No youtube link for song found

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body: No song is found although it can be found on youtube music. Below is a fix related to `availableDetails` and the API result that seems to be different for me. ### Examples Red Hot Chili Peppers - By the Way ```bash % spotdl "https://open.spotify.com/track/2t0ZYmVXMR36fchq1Egs2d?si=-FvA7hw9TBWyk4-ju_W9Ww" Fetching Song... Skipping By the Way (https://open.spotify.com/track/2t0ZYmVXMR36fchq1Egs2d?si=-FvA7hw9TBWyk4-ju_W9Ww) as no match could be found on youtube 0%| |ETA: ?, ~min/song ``` Arctic Monkeys - The View From The Afternoon ```bash % spotdl "https://open.spotify.com/track/5eyTC5GZzpzlN7YRO9AoPf?si=xhsQtL-oQS-1ElvIopJGpw" Fetching Song... Skipping The View From The Afternoon (https://open.spotify.com/track/5eyTC5GZzpzlN7YRO9AoPf?si=xhsQtL-oQS-1ElvIopJGpw) as no match could be found on youtube 0%| |ETA: ?, ~min/song ``` ### Debug It seems like this is due to [line 250 in spotdl.search.provider](https://github.com/spotDL/spotify-downloader/blob/b7a517bba2eda8fbcdbe22fb69bdbc8745cb28d5/spotdl/search/provider.py#L250) that is never true: ```python # Filterout non-Song/Video results and incomplete results here itself #! From what we know about detail order, note that [1] - indicate result type if availableDetails[1] in ['Song', 'Video'] and len(availableDetails) == 5: [...] ``` The result seems to be quite different from what you expect: ```bash % spotdl "https://open.spotify.com/track/5eyTC5GZzpzlN7YRO9AoPf?si=xhsQtL-oQS-1ElvIopJGpw" Fetching Song... *** spotdl.search.provider.__query_and_simplify.contentBlocks[0].result *** [{'musicResponsiveListItemFlexColumnRenderer': {'displayPriority': 'MUSIC_RESPONSIVE_LIST_ITEM_COLUMN_DISPLAY_PRIORITY_HIGH', 'text': {'runs': [{'navigationEndpoint': {'clickTrackingParams': 'CMwBENNoGAAiEwittLaG-PXtAhWOlXsKHavXDLk=', 'watchEndpoint': {'playlistId': 'RDAMVMPeQAZsyucbQ', 'videoId': 'PeQAZsyucbQ', 'watchEndpointMusicSupportedConfigs': {'watchEndpointMusicConfig': {'musicVideoType': 'MUSIC_VIDEO_TYPE_OMV'}}}}, 'text': 'The ' 'View ' 'From ' 'the ' 'Afternoon'}]}}}, {'musicResponsiveListItemFlexColumnRenderer': {'displayPriority': 'MUSIC_RESPONSIVE_LIST_ITEM_COLUMN_DISPLAY_PRIORITY_HIGH', 'text': {'runs': [{'text': 'Video'}, {'text': ' ' '• '}, {'navigationEndpoint': {'browseEndpoint': {'browseEndpointContextSupportedConfigs': {'browseEndpointContextMusicConfig': {'pageType': 'MUSIC_PAGE_TYPE_ARTIST'}}, 'browseId': 'UC8Yu1_yfN5qPh601Y4btsYw'}, 'clickTrackingParams': 'CMwBENNoGAAiEwittLaG-PXtAhWOlXsKHavXDLk='}, 'text': 'Arctic ' 'Monkeys'}, {'text': ' ' '• '}, {'text': '12M ' 'views'}, {'text': ' ' '• '}, {'text': '4:35'}]}}}] *** spotdl.search.provider.__query_and_simplify.contentBlocks[0].linkBlock *** {'clickTrackingParams': 'CNkBEMjeAiITCK20tob49e0CFY6Vewodq9cMuQ==', 'watchEndpoint': {'params': 'wAEB', 'playlistId': 'RDAMVMPeQAZsyucbQ', 'videoId': 'PeQAZsyucbQ', 'watchEndpointMusicSupportedConfigs': {'watchEndpointMusicConfig': {'musicVideoType': 'MUSIC_VIDEO_TYPE_OMV'}}}} *** next loop *** spotdl.search.provider.__query_and_simplify.resultBlocks[0].availableDetails ['The View From the Afternoon', 'Video'] spotdl.search.provider.__query_and_simplify.resultBlocks[0].len(availableDetails) 2 spotdl.search.provider.__query_and_simplify.resultBlocks[0].availableDetails ['The View From the Afternoon', 'Song'] spotdl.search.provider.__query_and_simplify.resultBlocks[0].len(availableDetails) 2 spotdl.search.provider.__query_and_simplify.resultBlocks[0].availableDetails ['Arctic Monkeys - The View From The Afternoon', 'Video'] spotdl.search.provider.__query_and_simplify.resultBlocks[0].len(availableDetails) 2 spotdl.search.provider.__query_and_simplify.resultBlocks[0].availableDetails ["Whatever People Say I Am, That's What I Am Not", 'Album'] spotdl.search.provider.__query_and_simplify.resultBlocks[0].len(availableDetails) 2 spotdl.search.provider.__query_and_simplify.resultBlocks[0].availableDetails ['The view from the afternoon :)', 'Playlist'] spotdl.search.provider.__query_and_simplify.resultBlocks[0].len(availableDetails) 2 ``` Here is where I see potential for a fix in [line 239 in spotdl.search.provider](https://github.com/spotDL/spotify-downloader/blob/b7a517bba2eda8fbcdbe22fb69bdbc8745cb28d5/spotdl/search/provider.py#L239) code: ```python #! if not a dummy, collect all available details availableDetails.append( detail['musicResponsiveListItemFlexColumnRenderer'] \ ['text'] \ ['runs'][0] \ ['text'] ) print(detail['musicResponsiveListItemFlexColumnRenderer']['text']) ``` output: ```bash # this is song detail 1 with the Name {'runs': [{'navigationEndpoint': {'clickTrackingParams': 'CLsBEOFnGAAiEwiFoJTg_PXtAhXCQnoFHZ0PA0M=', 'watchEndpoint': {'playlistId': 'RDAMVMZw4WjFKZfI0', 'videoId': 'Zw4WjFKZfI0', 'watchEndpointMusicSupportedConfigs': {'watchEndpointMusicConfig': {'musicVideoType': 'MUSIC_VIDEO_TYPE_ATV'}}}}, 'text': 'The View From the Afternoon'}]} # this is the song detail 2 that contains type and *ALL* others {'runs': [{'text': 'Song'}, {'text': ' • '}, {'navigationEndpoint': {'browseEndpoint': {'browseEndpointContextSupportedConfigs': {'browseEndpointContextMusicConfig': {'pageType': 'MUSIC_PAGE_TYPE_ARTIST'}}, 'browseId': 'UC8Yu1_yfN5qPh601Y4btsYw'}, 'clickTrackingParams': 'CLsBEOFnGAAiEwiFoJTg_PXtAhXCQnoFHZ0PA0M='}, 'text': 'Arctic Monkeys'}, {'text': ' • '}, {'navigationEndpoint': {'browseEndpoint': {'browseEndpointContextSupportedConfigs': {'browseEndpointContextMusicConfig': {'pageType': 'MUSIC_PAGE_TYPE_ALBUM'}}, 'browseId': 'MPREb_1X7jgKSpSz7'}, 'clickTrackingParams': 'CLsBEOFnGAAiEwiFoJTg_PXtAhXCQnoFHZ0PA0M='}, 'text': "Whatever People Say I Am, That's What I Am Not"}, {'text': ' • '}, {'text': '3:38'}]} ``` So instead in your docs it would be: ``` # 03. Gather available details in the same place #! We only need results that are Songs or Videos, so we filter out the rest, since #! Songs and Videos are supplied with different details, extracting all details from #! both is just carrying on redundant data, so we also have to selectively extract #! relevant details. What you need to know to understand how we do that here: #! #! Songs details are ALWAYS in the following order: #! 0 - Name #! 1 - Type (Song), Artist, Album, Duration (mm:ss) (with • placeholders in between) ``` I'm not sure why my output is different. I'm in Denmark if that helps anything. ### Environment - **System OS:** OSX - **Python Version:** 3.9.1 - **Install Source:** the master branch on github - **Version OR Commit hash:** ``` commit b7a517bba2eda8fbcdbe22fb69bdbc8745cb28d5 (HEAD -> master, origin/master, origin/HEAD) Author: Silverarmor Date: Fri Dec 25 18:25:43 2020 +1300 ``` ------------------------------------------------------------ ### Expected Behaviour Song to be found ### Actual Behaviour Song is not found and skipped ### Steps to Reproduce Tried to download several songs always same result. 1. spotdl "https://open.spotify.com/track/5eyTC5GZzpzlN7YRO9AoPf?si=xhsQtL-oQS-1ElvIopJGpw" 2. Skipping XYZ as no match could be found on youtube

Click to Expand ! 

Fetching Song...                                                                                                   
  0%|                                                                                            |ETA: ?, ~min/songTraceback (most recent call last):
  File "/mnt/c/Users/bills/Desktop/Dotify/backend/.env/bin/spotdl", line 8, in 
    sys.exit(console_entry_point())
  File "/mnt/c/Users/bills/Desktop/Dotify/backend/.env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/spotdl/__main__.py", line 100, in console_entry_point
    downloader.download_single_song(song)
  File "/mnt/c/Users/bills/Desktop/Dotify/backend/.env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/spotdl/download/downloader.py", line 274, in download_single_song
    download_song(songObj, self.displayManager, self.downloadTracker)
  File "/mnt/c/Users/bills/Desktop/Dotify/backend/.env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/spotdl/download/downloader.py", line 102, in download_song
    youtubeHandler = YouTube(
  File "/mnt/c/Users/bills/Desktop/Dotify/backend/.env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pytube/__main__.py", line 91, in __init__
    self.prefetch()
  File "/mnt/c/Users/bills/Desktop/Dotify/backend/.env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pytube/__main__.py", line 183, in prefetch
    self.js_url = extract.js_url(self.watch_html)
  File "/mnt/c/Users/bills/Desktop/Dotify/backend/.env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pytube/extract.py", line 143, in js_url
    base_js = get_ytplayer_config(html)["assets"]["js"]
  File "/mnt/c/Users/bills/Desktop/Dotify/backend/.env/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pytube/extract.py", line 202, in get_ytplayer_config
    raise RegexMatchError(caller="get_ytplayer_config", pattern="config_patterns")
pytube.exceptions.RegexMatchError: get_ytplayer_config: could not find match for config_patterns
I was able to trace the problem back to the `pytube.__main__.prefetch` method, when called through the `YouTube` class constructor. _Attaching code snippet along with some values_ ```python def prefetch(self) -> None: """Eagerly download all necessary data. Eagerly executes all necessary network requests so all other operations don't does need to make calls outside of the interpreter which blocks for long periods of time. :rtype: None """ self.watch_html = request.get(url=self.watch_url) # self.watch_url == 'https://youtube.com/watch?v=KerML5uHywU' if self.watch_html is None: raise VideoUnavailable(video_id=self.video_id) self.age_restricted = extract.is_age_restricted(self.watch_html) if not self.age_restricted and "This video is private" in self.watch_html: raise VideoUnavailable(video_id=self.video_id) if self.age_restricted: if not self.embed_html: self.embed_html = request.get(url=self.embed_url) self.vid_info_url = extract.video_info_url_age_restricted( self.video_id, self.watch_url ) else: self.vid_info_url = extract.video_info_url( video_id=self.video_id, watch_url=self.watch_url ) # self.vid_info_url == 'https://youtube.com/get_video_info?video_id=KerML5uHywU&el=%24el&ps=default&eurl=https%253A%2F%2Fyoutube.com%2Fwatch%253Fv%253DKerML5uHywU&hl=en_US' self.vid_info_raw = request.get(self.vid_info_url) # self.vid_info_raw == 'status=fail&reason=Invalid+parameters.&errorcode=2' if not self.age_restricted: self.js_url = extract.js_url(self.watch_html) self.js = request.get(self.js_url) ``` As you can see the `GET` request returns an invalid response of `status=fail&reason=Invalid+parameters.&errorcode=2`, in this case. P.S. After reading through other issues I have already given single and double quotes a try as well as installing `pytube3` and/or force upgrading `pytube` and `spotdl`, with no result whatsoever

labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

labels.name: Stale
labels.description: Issue with no activity for the last 30 days

body:
I found that after loading downloaded songs into OSXs native music app, track lengths are not correctly displayed (whereas they are in finder). Somehow it shows the tracks to be roughly (not exactly) twice as long as they actually are. The track seems fine, nothing is duplicated and/or concatenated. After the track finishes, the music player just skips to the end. Scrubbing to a specific point in the song doesn't check out either. I'm assuming this issue is related to a previous issue mentioned in the code (Lines 145-149 in spotdl/download/downloader.py, where sample length and actual length don't match up)? 

I've been using V.3.1.4, and have already forced an update for pytube and cleanly reinstalled spotdl. The issue also seems to occur when using the latest version of spotdl.

Hi, I try to download a song, but it give an error.What's wrong with this, please?

title: download fails, then passes

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body:
#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [x] Bug
- [ ] Feature Request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other

### Description
While downloading a set of 16 tracks I got this error for 3 of the files:
json.decoder.JSONDecodeError: Unterminated string starting at: line 1 column 665 (char 664)

When retrying just thaat one request with debug logging enabled it worked.

When repeating the whole set with debug again 3 files failed. 2 of these passed in the same run.

Could this be that the response is split over two TCP/IP packets and that not all input has been received yet?

title: retain failing download urls

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body:
#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [ ] Bug
- [x] Feature Request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other

### Description
I bumped upon a failing download when downloading with -list
The line is still removed from the list even though the download failed.
It would be nice if these were not removed so at the end one still has the list of failed files

title: Allow files without .txt extension as argument to --list

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body:
#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [ ] Bug
- [x ] Feature Request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other

### Description
Some files failed to download, I wanted to retry them and copied the url's to a file called "tst"
When I pass that file to spotdl it says
error: tst is not of a valid argument to --list, argument must be plain text file.

If I rename the file to tst.txt the file is accepted.
On linux it is not uncommon to have ascii files without extension.

Suggestion is to remove the restriction (and maybe use a different way to determine if the file is ascii)

title: AttributeError: 'ArgumentHandler' object has no attribute 'parser'

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body:
<!--
Please follow the guide below

- Before opening your ticket, make sure you either installed the latest release from PyPI
  or installed directly from the master branch and have searched through existing issues
  including closed ones.
-->

<!--
- Put an `x` into the box [ ] below (like [x]) depending on the purpose of your issue
- Use *Preview* tab to see how your issue will actually look like
-->

#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [x ] Bug
- [ ] Feature Request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other

### Description
<!-- Provide as much information possible and whatever you have tried below -->
When using the -f args in the command line for downloading a playlist, an error is occuring saying  

Example of command used. In bold the argument which creates the error
spotdl --list ./PlaylistSpotdl/playlistName.txt -o m4a **-f "./Music/playlistName"** --write-successful "./Music/playlistName/_downloadedfiles.txt" --skip "./Music/playlistName/_downloadedfiles.txt" --overwrite skip
```console
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "c:\users\vhavard\appdata\local\continuum\anaconda3\envs\spotdl\lib\runpy.py", line 193, in _run_module_as_main
    "__main__", mod_spec)
  File "c:\users\vhavard\appdata\local\continuum\anaconda3\envs\spotdl\lib\runpy.py", line 85, in _run_code
    exec(code, run_globals)
  File "C:\Users\vhavard\AppData\Local\Continuum\anaconda3\envs\spotdl\Scripts\spotdl.exe\__main__.py", line 7, in <module>
  File "c:\users\vhavard\appdata\local\continuum\anaconda3\envs\spotdl\lib\site-packages\spotdl\command_line\__main__.py", line 24, in main
    with Spotdl(args) as spotdl_handler:
  File "c:\users\vhavard\appdata\local\continuum\anaconda3\envs\spotdl\lib\site-packages\spotdl\command_line\core.py", line 38, in __init__
    arguments = argument_handler.run_errands()
  File "c:\users\vhavard\appdata\local\continuum\anaconda3\envs\spotdl\lib\site-packages\spotdl\command_line\arguments.py", line 364, in run_errands
    self.parser.get_default("output_file")
AttributeError: 'ArgumentHandler' object has no attribute 'parser'
```

Without, this -f args, everything is working as it should.  

### possible fix
Adding this code in the ArgumentsHandler class make it works fine for me
``` python
class ArgumentHandler:
    def __init__(self, args={}, config_base=_CONFIG_BASE):
        self.config_base = config_base
        self.args = args
        self.configured_args = self._from_args(args)
        # Fixed by VHD
        self.parser = get_arguments()
``` 

### Log
<!-- Run the script with `--log-level=DEBUG` and paste the output below-->

title: KeyError: 'cipher': Most tracks fail to download

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body:
<!--
Please follow the guide below

- Before opening your ticket, make sure you either installed the latest release from PyPI
  or installed directly from the master branch and have searched through existing issues
  including closed ones.
-->

<!--
- Put an `x` into the box [ ] below (like [x]) depending on the purpose of your issue
- Use *Preview* tab to see how your issue will actually look like
-->

#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [x] Bug
- [ ] Feature Request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other

### Description

When I try to download a playlist spotdl will download one song and then crash.

I generated a playlist .txt file using the spodl --playlist command, but when I run the spotdl --list command only one song will download. Then the entire program will crash after attempting to fetch the metadata of the next song. Running the command again immediatly crashes and shows the same errors.

If I wait for a few minutes before running the command, it will again download one song and crash after attempting to fetch the metadata of the next song.


### Log
<details>
<summary>
$ spotdl --list well-this-is-me.txt -ll debug
</summary>

title: Downloading songs manually and then skipping a song using 0 (zero) crashes the script

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body:
<!--
Please follow the guide below

- Before opening your ticket, make sure you either installed the latest release from PyPI
  or installed directly from the master branch and have searched through existing issues
  including closed ones.
-->

<!--
- Put an `x` into the box [ ] below (like [x]) depending on the purpose of your issue
- Use *Preview* tab to see how your issue will actually look like
-->

#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [x] Bug
- [ ] Feature Request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other

### Description
<!-- Provide as much information possible and whatever you have tried below -->
In the config.yml file I set song downloading to "manual: true". The song downloader works with numbers 1 through 10, but skipping the song with 0 (zero) crashes the script it seems. 
Using the "-m" tag in the command window does the same thing.
It's not the biggest hassle as doing it manually you can simply relaunch the script and all is well.

Probably my final bug report so thanks again for making this awesome, insanely useful program. Apologies if this was a matter of installing somethign falsely.

### Log
<!-- Run the script with `--log-level=DEBUG` and paste the output below-->
https://pastebin.com/sp5T4Pmg

title: Possible to use config.yml with Docker?

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body:
#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Feature Request
- [x ] Question
- [ ] Other

### Description
I am running the Docker version of spotify-downloader and would like to use a config.yml configuration file.  The docs say that this will be created when running the command for the first time, but this does not happen with Docker.  Is it possible to do this?  I am using the app using:

```docker run --rm -it -v $(pwd):/music ritiek/spotify-downloader```

If it is possible, is there an example config.yml that I can download from GH or elsewhere?

title: Tests are failing because Green Day has a new album

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body:
#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [X] Bug
- [ ] Feature Request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other

### Description
The test method `test_len` in the class `TestFetchAlbumsFromArtist` in `test_spotify_tools.py` is failing, because the number of playlists of this artist has increased (from 52 to 53). Therefore, we should probably mock this test to avoid such a problem in the future.

Similar test cases (e.g. class `TestFetchPlaylist` in the same file) have been mocked by creating a test playlist. This is not possible for the failing test case because we would need an artist account which has to be confirmed by Spotify.

I think the best option to mock this test is by downloading the HTML code of the website of the artist. Thus the amount of albums won't change and this bug will not appear again.

If you think this is a good way to go, I can implement this. Looking forward to responses :)

#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [x] Bug
- [ ] Feature Request

- [ ] Other

### Description
Using --all-albums on a artist url leads to the following error.
Has happened with multiple artists already, here is one for reference:

#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [x] Bug
- [ ] Feature Request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other

### Description
<!-- Provide as much information possible and whatever you have tried below -->
Hi,
When I try to download any song(from spotify of course) sometimes it stuck, sometimes it doesn't. Generally it stucks at the "Fetching Lyrics", I didin't found any way to download without the lyrics to test my hypothesis. So firstly I was thinking it was a problem with my network, DNS or something like that. I checked everything even I changed the DNS Server for test purposes, but nothing seemed to help. Secondly I was thinking it was a problem with my system cause I actually use Gentoo Linux and things can happen on that distro. Thinking on that I tested on my personal torrent server with Ubuntu 18.04 and it stucks too.

The only hypothesis that surround my mind now, is a Youtube-dl problem. cause on last builds of youtube-dl I had to set the option "--force-ipv4" at the command or on it's config if no it stucks too and don't download my videos from Youtube. Apparently cabled network in my country is not prepared to handle with ipv6 yet. On the other hand,  I have a other internet provider who provides me internet to my smartphone and theathering internet to PC everything works as well.

Thanks, and sorry for any concordance errors.

title: Fix automatically overwriting the previously downloaded track if it gets placed in a sub-directory

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body:
- [x] Using latest verson as provided on the [master branch](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/tree/master)
- [x] [Searched](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue) for similar issues including closed ones

#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [x] Bug
- [ ] Feature Request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other

### Description

The tool automatically overwrites the previously downloaded track without prompting the user when file-format configuration option contains slashes for creating new directory (e.g. passing something like `-f "{artist}/{track_name}"`). We need to fix this so it prompts about overwriting the previously downloaded track as it does without file-format option containing slashes.

title: Break the loop

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body:
<!--
Please follow the guide below

- You will be asked some questions and requested to provide some information, please read them CAREFULLY and answer honestly
- Put an `x` into all the boxes [ ] relevant to your *issue* (like that [x])
- Use *Preview* tab to see how your issue will actually look like
-->

- [x] Using latest version as provided on the [master branch](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/tree/master)
- [x] [Searched](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue) for similar issues including closed ones

#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [ ] Bug
- [ ] Feature Request
- [x] Question
- [ ] Other

### Description
<!-- Provide as much information possible and whatever you have tried below -->
Hi.
Sometimes I read this log from spotdl:
```
INFO: Skipping "bla bla bla bla.mp3"
ERROR: This video contains content from WMG, who has blocked it in your country on copyright grounds.
WARNING: Failed to download song. Will retry after other songs

ERROR: This video contains content from WMG, who has blocked it in your country on copyright grounds.
WARNING: Failed to download song. Will retry after other songs
```
and spend a lot of time repeating this loop...
How can I do that in such cases, just give the warning and go to the next song or end the list?
Thanks

### Log
<!-- Run the script with `--log-level=DEBUG` and paste the output below-->

title: Invalid MultiSpec data, problem with value in meta_tags['publisher']

#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [x] Bug
- [ ] Feature Request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other

### Description
<!-- Provide as much information possible and whatever you have tried below -->

Was downloading from list when I got this error. All of the other 800+ songs downloaded just fine, only this song seemed to have an issue. #82 seems related, however it's the publisher meta_tag that seems to be causing trouble. Also #148 has the publisher meta_tag as the culprit, but the line giving me trouble is `audiofile['TPUB'] = TPUB(encoding=3, text=meta_tags['publisher'])` which does not check for the existence of `meta_tags['publisher']` so 2f0018adce50851c994868d24a235c24a71d0540 doesn't address my problem. Just to get it working, I temporarily modified line 77 of metadata.py to be:

```
if meta_tags['publisher']
     audiofile['TPUB'] = TPUB(encoding=3, text=meta_tags['publisher'])
```

And it "fixed" the issue, in that the song downloaded without throwing an exception, but I'm not familiar with the code so I have no idea if that broke something.

title: Having duplicates in track file messes up deletion of tracks from track file

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body:
- [x] Using latest version as provided on the [master branch](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/tree/master)
- [x] [Searched](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue) for similar issues including closed ones

#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [x] Bug
- [ ] Feature Request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other

### Description
As the title says. Say we have a `track_file.txt`with (duplicate) tracks as below:
```
https://open.spotify.com/track/2DGa7iaidT5s0qnINlwMjJ
https://open.spotify.com/track/2DGa7iaidT5s0qnINlwMjJ
https://open.spotify.com/track/3SipFlNddvL0XNZRLXvdZD
```

On downloading these tracks we get:
```
$ spotdl -l=track_file.txt -d 
INFO: Preparing to download 2 songs

INFO: 1. Alan Walker ‒ The Spectre (Lyrics / Lyrics Video)[HD] (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8lPa0963LEc)

INFO: 2. Janji - Heroes Tonight (feat. Johnning) [Lyrics] (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7bI36Iu6M6s)
```

```
$ cat track_file.txt
https://open.spotify.com/track/3SipFlNddvL0XNZRLXvdZD
```

spotdl internally removes the duplicates from the track file but does not rewrite the unique tracks back to `track_file.txt`. So, when it successfully downloads the third track from the file in the above case, it deletes the second track instead of the third track and the third track lives on in `track_file.txt`

I can think of three solutions here:

- Fix this by filtering duplicates from track file and re-writing track file with unique tracks so that tracks from track file are deleted in proper order.

- Initially creating a new list of duplicate tracks in file and then take extra care to skip this track and remove it from file if it has been already downloaded once.

- Do nothing and let the script figure out on its own going with the `--overwrite` argument when the same track is being downloaded for the second time.

title: Lyrics are not correctly inserted in M4A files

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

labels.name: Enhancement
labels.description: Enhancing spotDL

body:
<!--
Please follow the guide below

- You will be asked some questions and requested to provide some information, please read them CAREFULLY and answer honestly
- Put an `x` into all the boxes [ ] relevant to your *issue* (like that [x])
- Use *Preview* tab to see how your issue will actually look like
-->

- [x] Using latest version as provided on the [master branch](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/tree/master)
- [x] [Searched](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue) for similar issues including closed ones

#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [x] Bug
- [ ] Feature Request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other

### Description

When saving metadata to an M4A file, the lyrics tag is not used correctly:
https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/blob/master/spotdl/metadata.py#L99
```python
if meta_tags['lyrics']:
    audiofile['lyrics'] = meta_tags['lyrics']
```
should actually be replaced by

```python
if meta_tags['lyrics']:
    audiofile[M4A_TAG_PRESET['lyrics']] = meta_tags['lyrics']
```

Additionally, I would propose for the website URL as used in the MP3 implementation to be placed in the M4A's comments, so that the spotify URL will be preserved:

```python
audiofile[M4A_TAG_PRESET['comment']] = meta_tags['external_urls']['spotify']
```

If you're interested in this fix and/or the feature, I can submit a PR

title: Importing into iTunes: unknown bitrate, unknown time

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

Please follow the guide below

-->

- [ x] Using latest version as provided on the [master branch](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/tree/master)
- [x ] [Searched](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue) for similar issues including closed ones

- [x ] Bug
- [ ] Feature Request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other

### Description
<!-- Provide as much information possible and whatever you have tried below -->

title: Porting Music to Iphone bug

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body:
<!--
Please follow the guide below

- You will be asked some questions and requested to provide some information, please read them CAREFULLY and answer honestly
- Put an `x` into all the boxes [ ] relevant to your *issue* (like that [x])
- Use *Preview* tab to see how your issue will actually look like
-->

- [x] Using latest version as provided on the [master branch](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/tree/master)
- [x] [Searched](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue) for similar issues including closed ones

#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [x] Bug
- [ ] Feature Request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other

### Description
<!-- Provide as much information possible and whatever you have tried below -->
Music downloads fine, can play it on PC without any problems, however when i port the music from my PC to IPhone via itunes, it goes to my music at it should, but when i play it it merges two songs into one, it may say for example, "Aer - Island" and it'll play that song, but it says it is ~5mins long when it should be ~2mins, once it finishes the song, Island, at the ~2min mark, it starts another song, which seems to always be the one underneath, or up next, but the song timer goes to ~5mins, and keeps the original song label, and name "Aer - Island" but will play a different song. I originally copy +_pasted to songs onto phone in one go, this bug happened, so i removed them from phone restarted it, then added then one by one, shuffled them, restarted phone again, and the bug still is here. If you play a song, and it gets to the quote on quote "second song" whilst still being under the original song, delete the song its playing from library, which will be the one labelled as up-next, it'll stop playing that one and start playing the new song labelled as "up-next", guessing this is a problem w/ my phone but was hoping someone knew how to fix it.

### Log
<!-- Run the script with `--log-level=DEBUG` and paste the output below-->
No log, music download works fine, can play it on my PC without any problems or loops

title: Track titles containing slashes create a new directory

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body:
For example, if I try downloading this track:
```
$ python3 spotdl.py -s "nightcore - darkside - alan walker"
INFO: Nightcore - Darkside - (Alan Walker / Lyrics) (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8N_aay0ddcY)
WARNING: Could not find metadata
  2,943,243 Bytes [100.00%] received. Rate: [  140 KB/s].  ETA: [0 secs]
INFO: Converting Nightcore - Darkside - (Alan Walker / Lyrics).m4a to mp3
```

It ends up creating a new directory in the target directory with the name `Nightcore - Darkside - (Alan Walker ` and the mp3 is stored in this newly created directory with filename as ` Lyrics).mp3`. Not so cool.

(I think there was a similar issue reported in the past but I couldn't find it)

This is on the latest commit (5b4efa05b68e6e00ecc1852ebb2e7d5c3ca3b2e9). There maybe a similar problem on Windows (with backslashes?) but haven't tried yet.

We should probably replace these special characters to avoid creating a new directory.

title: Similar named track already downloaded prompts about overwriting

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body:
If a track whose filename comes in a track which has been already been downloaded we get prompted about overwriting the old track. For example, this is a false positive case:

```
$ python3 spotdl.py -s "nightcore - uncover you"
INFO: Nightcore - Uncover You - (Lyrics) (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9B8yuzO5HkU)
WARNING: Could not find metadata
  3,231,717.0 Bytes [100.00%] received. Rate: [1020 KB/s].  ETA: [0 secs]    
INFO: Converting Nightcore - Uncover You - (Lyrics).m4a to mp3

$ ls ~/Music/
'Nightcore - Uncover You - (Lyrics).mp3'

$ python3 spotdl.py -s "nightcore - uncover"
INFO: Nightcore - Uncover (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dz3C_EDx2kE)
WARNING: Could not find metadata
WARNING: "Nightcore - Uncover You - (Lyrics).mp3" already exists
INFO: "Nightcore - Uncover You - (Lyrics).mp3" has already been downloaded. Re-download? (y/N): 
> y
  3,133,515.0 Bytes [100.00%] received. Rate: [ 1830 KB/s].  ETA: [0 secs]    
INFO: Converting Nightcore - Uncover.m4a to mp3

$ ls ~/Music/
'Nightcore - Uncover.mp3'
```

These are two different nightcore tracks. The first track's filename is "Nightcore - Uncover You - (Lyrics)" while second track's filename is "Nightcore - Uncover" and by our current logic, it would end up assuming same track has been already been downloaded.
```python
>>>  "Nightcore - Uncover" in "Nightcore - Uncover You - (Lyrics)"
True
```

We need to refactor our function which checks for duplicate filenames and possibly even add a regression test.

title: UnicodeEncodeError when non-ascii character in title of song

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body:
- [x] Using latest version as provided on the [master branch](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/tree/master)
- [x] [Searched](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue) for similar issues including closed ones

#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [x] Bug
- [ ] Feature Request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Otherh

### Description
I'm getting an error when trying to download "HOLD ME TIGHT OR DON'T" due to the apostrophe in the character. Apparently the title uses the "RIGHT SINGLE QUOTATION MARK" (U+2019) rather than the "APOSTROPHE" (U+0027).

title: Manual mode does not shows the complete list of matching videos

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body:
#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [x] Bug
- [ ] Feature Request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other

### Description
Some search terms result only one or two videos in manual mode. For example:
```
$ python3 spotdl.py -s "she is still sleeping SAO" -m
```
When running this command in debug mode, it says about opening this URL:
```
DEBUG: Opening URL: https://www.youtube.com/results?sp=EgIQAQ%253D%253D&q=she%20is%20still%20sleeping%20SAO
INFO: she is still sleeping SAO
INFO: 0. Skip downloading this song.

INFO: 1. She is Still Sleeping - Sword Art Online Music Extended 14:21 http://youtube.com/watch?v=KtJ7chF-K_Y
INFO: Choose your number:
>
```
https://www.youtube.com/results?sp=EgIQAQ%253D%253D&q=she+is+still+sleeping+SAO
This page shows far more results in the browser than the manual mode.

Even when YouTube API key is set in `config.yml`, it still gives only 1 song to choose from. However, it does mention about other video ids in debug mode:

```
DEBUG: query: {'part': 'snippet', 'maxResults': 50, 'type': 'video', 'q': 'she is still sleeping SAO'}
DEBUG: query_results: {'part': 'contentDetails,snippet,statistics', 'maxResults': 50, 'id': 'KtJ7chF-K_Y,AQchUyg9pCQ,h-i8PJ1pVpw,ie-PKbA7xVw,W7oyHIfyJdE,QR3msDZYUXE,APM-fay0ZMY,F28a_SLr1rU,BS4cWm0hcko,zpH6QPeCPmQ,W4pU8bz3zcc,CrspX3R2u-g,hMyi-2tricg,uXMK9u2JIAY,X3IQ2sXxGBQ,SFVprq8lRfU,hzOCp-XbWYA,X9lF4nUP2gs,J0QjIQt79sE,hWTdL9zBmAM,xujK-0HhBOs,tP4wj1opkjU,KuJjZ_Jeq3A,ytzAGe_lP4k,hd3I50w_gsw,eDsVyur8Cbk,GM-NsUAzatQ,nuLZCMCfgvU,5osauN6Uuhs,Sj2OKBBfUgU,MVzSGXS6ZFM,uU2rY77MP_4,qV2IEni0IXs,6TNF9YRTKlg,1XeWztRZXYE,35wuVkgSaoc,ZoEtBn_6KOI,RcfgUIdt1qE,-NDouCc4Q94,zKVtNYr5Ecg,4haLDk9Cji8,pAU7y1qvpN4,WoI023b5SQI,YBLmRfSKQfQ,b3sw7mak9Ps,ZhtTuC5l3Cc,lY2yjAdbvdQ,DaIaHC3vJ4M,PZM2pFAYing,Pd-Fxje6AQs'}
INFO: she is still sleeping SAO
INFO: 0. Skip downloading this song.

INFO: 1. She is Still Sleeping - Sword Art Online Music Extended 14:21 http://youtube.com/watch?v=KtJ7chF-K_Y

>
```

We need to check out what's really going on in here and why other videos are not being shown in manual mode.

title: WARNING: Failed to download song. Will retry after other songs

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body:

- [X ] Using latest version as provided on the [master branch](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/tree/master)

- [X] Bug
- [ ] Feature Request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body:
<!--
Please follow the guide below

- You will be asked some questions and requested to provide some information, please read them CAREFULLY and answer honestly
- Put an `x` into all the boxes [ ] relevant to your *issue* (like that [x])
- Use *Preview* tab to see how your issue will actually look like
-->

- [x] Using latest version as provided on the [master branch](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/tree/master)
- [x] [Searched](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue) for similar issues including closed ones

#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [x] Bug
- [ ] Feature Request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other

### Description
<!-- Provide as much information possible and whatever you have tried below -->

So I use the new configuration file now. It set `no-spaces` to `false`, spaces were in the file name. When setting `no-spaces: true`, the spaces are replaced by dashes.

It turns out that this happens with songs where no metadata is found on Spotify, as those with metadata have the correct underscores.

Even after looking at the source, I can't really understand what's going wrong...

title: Tell the user to install `unicode-slugify` in case of ImportError

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body:
#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [x] Bug
- [ ] Feature Request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other

### Description

As [awesome-slugify](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/awesome-slugify), [python-slugify](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/python-slugify) and [unicode-slugify](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/unicode-slugify) use the same import name (i.e. `import slugify`), it is possible for user to import a (previously installed) wrong package (instead of `unicode-slugify`, the one we use).

@sdhutchins noticed that `unicode-slugify` uses a constant called `SLUG_OK` which can help determine if we are using the right *slugify*, otherwise it will raise an error.

> ImportError: cannot import name 'SLUG_OK'

Perhaps, we should add [this line](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/blob/fe11ade68701e0429a98b580a420c8849b761a47/core/internals.py#L4) in a `try-except` block and tell the user to remove any other *slugifies* and install `unicode-slugify` in case of an exception.

title: Spotify Access Token expires after 1 hour

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body:
<!--
Please follow the guide below

- You will be asked some questions and requested to provide some information, please read them CAREFULLY and answer honestly

- [x] [Searched](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue) for similar issues including closed ones

#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [ ] Script won't run
- [x] Encountered bug
- [x] Feature request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other

#### System information
- Your `python` version: `python 3.6.3`
- Your operating system: `Windows 10 (64-bit)`

### Description
<!-- Provide as much information possible with relevant examples and whatever you have tried below -->
It appears that spotify uses a token system to allow access to songs.  This token expires every hour, so if a large list of songs where to be processed that takes over an hour the script will fail to access spotify with an HTTP 401 error.  It is my understanding that spotify allows applications to refresh the token an unlimited number of times, so it might be a beneficial feature to have the script refresh the token.

An alternative fix/workaround is to break download lists into smaller lists and run the script on each list successively.  For me It appears to process about 200 songs in 1 hour but I can see this easily being network speed dependent.

body:
<!--
Please follow the guide below

- You will be asked some questions and requested to provide some information, please read them CAREFULLY and answer honestly

- Use *Preview* tab to see how your issue will actually look like
-->

- [x] Using latest version as provided on the [master branch](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/tree/master)
- [x] [Searched](https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue) for similar issues including closed ones

#### What is the purpose of your *issue*?
- [x] Script won't run
- [x] Encountered bug
- [ ] Feature request
- [ ] Question
- [ ] Other

#### System information
- Your `python` version: `python 3.5`
- Your operating system: `Linux Mint 18.1`

### Description
<!-- Provide as much information possible with relevant examples and whatever you have tried below -->

After trying to download a song I get:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "spotdl.py", line 340, in <module>
    grab_single(raw_song=args.song)
  File "spotdl.py", line 294, in grab_single
    content = go_pafy(raw_song)
  File "spotdl.py", line 103, in go_pafy
    track_url = generate_youtube_url(raw_song)
  File "spotdl.py", line 64, in generate_youtube_url
    song = generate_songname(meta_tags)
  File "spotdl.py", line 20, in generate_songname
    content = go_pafy(raw_song)
UnboundLocalError: local variable 'raw_song' referenced before assignment
```

And obviously someone broke `generate_songname`, accessing `raw_song` when there is _no_ `raw_song` in the current namespace:

```
def generate_songname(tags):
    """Generate a string of the format '[artist] - [song]' for the given song."$

    if tags is None:
        content = go_pafy(raw_song)
        raw_song = get_youtube_title(content)
    else:
        raw_song = u'{0} - {1}'.format(tags['artists'][0]['name'], tags['name'])
    return raw_song
```

The function above was changed here: https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/commit/d28ff08a69bf650a23a81041a0f21406ca1e9459#diff-38708ff72d33e57adb6521d80606ba03 and probably broken here: https://github.com/ritiek/spotify-downloader/commit/4cf8a210bfc9331dda550941125b57a40d97f180#diff-38708ff72d33e57adb6521d80606ba03

_Could_ be related to Issue #116.
<!-- Give your issue a relevant title and you are good to go -->

title: Song title that's the same as the album title will be downloaded as full album

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Unexpected problem or unintended behavior that needs to be fixed

body: When downloading, I've noticed something very strange, let's say you have an album titled [TITLE], generally a lot of these albums will contain a song with the same title. But when this link is used with the program it will actually instead of downloading just that [TITLE].mp3 song, will download the entire [TITLE] album and combine it into a single .mp3. I've noticed this on multiple occurrences. If this can be solved that'd be amazing, I love this tool very much.
